website_summaries.verdict: Though it's small and lightweight, this Bosch is a capable contender.
pros: "Constant Response" motor circuitry supplies power in relation to load
cons: Not the most powerful tool in terms of horsepower

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool, But Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Two stars because Bosch tools are great and hold up very well. I use these at work and they're fantastic Buyer beware, mine came and it looked like it had fallen out of an airplane. It's not easy to dent hard plastic cases like this, but somebody certainly managed...unacceptable. I actually got this over the newer model because of the included case...not a good move. The real kicker is that the amazon box is in absolutely perfect condition, so they packed it knowingly damaged and sent it out anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Connor B.

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else -  Will NOT hold its depth setting.
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the other negative reviews and not bought this router. Well, I listened enough to: 1) thoroughly read the instructions (on the off chance the other negative reviewers hadn't) and 2) try it out on a scrap piece of oak with a freud roundover bit before trying it on a real project. Conclusion: this router will NOT hold its depth setting; it started slipping to a deeper setting as I began to slowly and carefully start down the piece of oak. This is a real surprise; I have the larger Bosch 1617 and it has been a great tool...no issues whatsoever with it. Stay away from the Colt.
customer_reviews.author: sgsargenttx

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid but fine height adjustment is hit-or-miss
customer_reviews.text: I'm thinking that variable speed is not really needed in this tool so you can save yourself a couple of bucks and just get the fixed speed model. Making fine adjustments to the cutter height is difficult. You have to anticipate how much that adjustment is going to shift as a result of locking down the clamping lever. It even mentions this several times in the manual. The fine-adjustment knurled thumb-wheel is difficult to operate and gets very tight and sticky. In a tool like this, rock-solid height adjustment is pretty dang critical. The sketchiness of the height adjustment is why I down-graded this review.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Truesdell

customer_reviews.title: Depth adjustment doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The base, the depth adjustment, and the locking mechanism are poorly designed. If locked too tight, the depth adjustment is not working. If locked so that adjustment is still possible it will not maintain its depth. I have resorted to a trial and error approach for now until I can come up with some sort of retrofit. The threaded collar designs used by the competition seems much more precise and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: PVH

customer_reviews.title: The best handheld router, I have 3.
customer_reviews.text: This router has all the features that you want in a handheld router. It's powerful enough to take a 1/4" bite with a 1-1/4" core box bit in maple, ash and other softwoods, 1/8"-3/16" hardwoods. The optional plunge base is very useful (two-handed stability and control) and can work in smaller restricted areas than my large 1-1/2 hp to 3-1/2 hp routers. My oldest Bosch 1 hp Colt is 12 years old and I have not had any issues with any of them. I have three so that I don't have to change bits between operations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Luke

customer_reviews.title: Router is trash
customer_reviews.text: Router works fine, base, adjustment, and locking mechanism is crap. I bought this specifically for inlays, and I have to pretty much do it by hand. I would not recommend this tool to anyone. Where the base locks in and out to the micro adjustments stripped out the first day.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great little router
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight palm router. Good power for it's size, variable speed, easy set up, usable case - Overall a good product. After you've used it for a while, look into the plunge base, and you'll find you're using it more and more. The edge guide and the case were the only negatives I've found. The case will not hold the optional plunge base, so you'll be looking for a larger case once you purchase that extremely useful attachment. The edge guide is inexpensive and useful for the lighter work, but it's difficult to hold for a higher precision work..
customer_reviews.author: ScorpioTgr

customer_reviews.title: Wish had more power.....
customer_reviews.text: My first one cooked. Smoked. I didn't think I was pushing it. I had purchased the plunge kit and was using a plunge 1/4" bit on 3/4" plywood. The next model up has more amps so more power. Too late. My plunge kit add on would not fit on that model so I had buy the same as before. Was not worth investing in another router and another plunge kit. It is versatile and easy to use. Just sorely disappointed about the weak power. Not sure why Bosch even offers 2 models only 2 amps apart in power????? Consider the next one up from this model.
customer_reviews.author: Pool Contractor

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful
customer_reviews.text: Great tool with excellent features. Comes with a case that has additional space for optional accessories. I have the bigger version of this tool, but am not using it as much as I would like due to the size and hassle of getting it out and setting it up. I find the palm router much faster and easier to use; reaching for it when I don't want to deal with the bigger router or setting up the router table.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Best tool in my shop
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router two years ago. I rarely write reviews on Amazon, but felt this one was due. I have been am amateur woodworker since the mid-70s, and since retirement, a professional toy-maker. When I look around my shop I see no tool more useful than this router. My first two routers were full-size routers and I was never happy with the control and results. This router is powerful and versatile while being so easily handled. I use it for toymaking, furniture and frames. The quality of the tool is consistent with my other Bosch tools.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: This router was amazingly comfortable to work with
customer_reviews.text: This is my first router. I only work on wood projects on occasion and only need a light router to be able to make dados and rabbets on shelving projects. This router was amazingly comfortable to work with. It's light, just heavy enough to provide a good amount of weight to be able to stay close to the project. The grip is very ergonomic! I've only used it on a couple of projects, so I hope that it's built to last!
customer_reviews.author: L. Franco

customer_reviews.title: I am TOTALLY disappointed with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am TOTALLY disappointed with this purchase! There are three different dimensions from the edges of the base to the center of the installed bit, making routing inside of a jig nearly impossible. No matter how tight the collet is secured, router bit "creep" occurs messing up expensive projects. Talk about buyers remorse---I will NEVER purchase another Bosch product!
customer_reviews.author: Vern in Idaho

customer_reviews.title: A really fine small router
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good small router. I have been using it for door hinges, lock sets and other small wood working jobs. It has a really nice balance and it easy to steer and control. The start up goes through 2 speeds to keep the start up torque under control. If it has a weak point, it is in the accuracy of the depth adjustment, but you can easily compensate for this by using a measured wood scrap to reset the depth as needed between blade change outs. Overall, this just really behaves well and is a pleasure to use - it feels really good in your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Bledsoeo from NY

customer_reviews.title: WILL RUIN YOUR PROJECT
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this router, I used this router a total of 2 times for a rather short amount of time (probably less than 2 hours total). The first time I used the router it almost ruined my project because it will not hold cutting depth and it will cut deeper than you intend to. The second time I used this router the end that holds the bit in place somehow became bent slightly just enough to ruin my project. I would not recommend this router to anyone. I would say save the time and headache and by a Dewalt instead.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my shop!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a "full size" router for years, but I recently took the plunge on this little guy. I only wish I had bought it sooner. For 90% of my projects, this is all I need. The size is so much easier to manage, especially when doing round-overs on edges. The depth adjustment is quick and easy, and I find it much easier to change the bits on this unit, than a full size router.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W.

customer_reviews.title: decent router
customer_reviews.text: I've had many routers. I wouldn't say this is going to be my favorite, (I still own a half dozen) but it seems decent. The adjustment seems ok, but yes, it doesn't seem to stay locked on a depth that well. But perhaps I'll get used to it and figure out how to manage that better. I think too many tools try to make things simpler and less complicated but in the end, they just aren't that precise or durable.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and set up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as part of a Bosch sale combined with a palm sander. I have a much older small router of another make that I don't like very much because the depth adjustment is very clunky. The depth adjustment on this one is easy and accurate. I used it in applications where I would ordinarily use a larger router or a router table and it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool.... worked for 15 minutes!
customer_reviews.text: Steer clear of this one. I had high hopes. Feels great in hand, has fine height adjustment. Like the other reviewer, after no more than total 15 minutes of operation time, it stopped working. Found that if I hit it with rubber hammer it kind of starts again, and dies after a few seconds. So probably contacts issue. Poor engineering by Bosch.
customer_reviews.author: Assaf

customer_reviews.title: Clever product name, but changed my mind and returned it.
customer_reviews.text: Upon deeper inspection and research, I decided the DeWalt 611pk was the better machine, much to my surprise. So I did a return with no regret. The DeWalt 611pk is a genius machine. The clear base alone makes it so much easier to see your work. And all the other design details surpass the Bosch Colt. It's no fun paying $100 more for the DeWalt, but I'm a tool snob, so I suffer for my perfection needs.
customer_reviews.author: WesleyMarsh

customer_reviews.title: ... - I’m just an occasional user but it feels like professional quality - very stout
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I need - I’m just an occasional user but it feels like professional quality - very stout. Good adjustability on speed. Depth of cut guide could be better but it is adequate. Easy to hold and routs accurately. I give it a thumbs up. Not for table routing - this is strictly a handheld unit.
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: I have a lot of other Bosch tools and have been very satisfied with them but this tool has a fatal flaw ...
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted the the motor slides in the base while in use. If tightened enough to hold it is too tight to adjust. The problem is that you just can't trust it to stay at a constant depth even though it feels very tight while not running. I think that the clamping mechanism has an in adequate range from loose to tight. So if it is loose enough to adjust it is too loose to hold when in use. If it is tight enough to hold it is too tight to adjust. I have a lot of other Bosch tools and have been very satisfied with them but this tool has a fatal flaw as a router.
customer_reviews.author: jddog

customer_reviews.title: NO CASE
customer_reviews.text: This items shows a plastic case with the item. Mine showed up in a cardboard box that was glued shut so no way to protect the tool after opening. VERY disappointed. This tool will be beat up after the first use and something important will surely be missing the next time I need it. One - use tool. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: James Du Fauconnoir

customer_reviews.title: Great product, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love it, but then again it's a Bosch! You would think you're using a regular size router only this is so much easier to see where your cuts are being made and not so heavy, which for me is crucial given I am very fine boned (woman) and not much tensile strength. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Richele R

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 18 months of light use.  Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Sure its a standard trim router, does what most do, but like every other POS out there the motors are junk. This thing died after 18 months of light use. Tools used to last 10 - 15 years from Bosch, not any more. Oh and thanks for 1 year warranty - its just enough to feel completely screwed. Have tried Dewalt, Porter Cable, and Makita with similar results, the Rigid is on the way, hopefully it won't have a low quality motor, after all - that's basically all this is is an electric motor, right?
customer_reviews.author: Taj Monjardo

customer_reviews.title: I think its dying
customer_reviews.text: I used it on one laminate job. Now there is a noticeable high pitch bearing noise that was not there before. It has a one year warranty, but if the manufacture deems it not bad you have to pay shipping. I am a little nervous to send it back, yet it seems like it will be failing soon. thought there warranty would be better then it seems
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great, use to use Router.
customer_reviews.text: Very user friendly tool. I've always been hesitant to use a router in the past. I've had a nice full size plunge router that has only been used twice in 6-7 years. When I received this I chucked a bit in it and went to town. I used a 6 ft level and come clamps and did a rabbet on some pallet wood to make my wife a rustic picture frame. Could not be happier with my purchase. This will definitely get used much more!
customer_reviews.author: D. Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Very nice hand-held router
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my ancient, venerable, and bulky Black and Decker from the '80's. The Colt is a small, lightweight, maneuverable little tool, that goes through Maple like paper. I have only had it for a few weeks, but I'm already planning new projects to use it for. Nice, powerful, and seems to be well made. Can you tell I like it?
customer_reviews.author: K. Rust

customer_reviews.title: Received WITHOUT case or guide...
customer_reviews.text: I specifically grabbed this as it said it came with the case to protect while on site. Per the Manufacturers description on Amazon description page: "The PR20EVSK also includes a self-releasing 1/4 In. collet chuck, comfortable forged bit-changing wrenches, edge guide and a case." I did not receive said case or edge guide and will likely return.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: This router worked well for about 2 weeks. I ...
customer_reviews.text: This router worked well for about 2 weeks. I used it for 7 or 8 projects and then it began to slow down. I increased the speed and then it began smoking and running very slowly. I will try to send it back to Bosch for repair or replacement. I registered the router online with my bosch profile but now I do not see it listed on my profile on the boschtools website. I'm hoping they will honor their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: DVF

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't live without it!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite tools. LOVE this little sucker!! And of course, Bosch quality all the way. I have the big Bosch plunge router but I always pass it by for this one. I'm of the female persuasion with weak hands so this one is perfect, easy to change router bits and adjust depth. Alright, I'll admit it... the big router scares me a little. I always feel I have control with this little one and it does a perfect job for the things I do; edge profiles, sliding dovetails, rabbets and that sort of thing.
customer_reviews.author: xkydivr

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to use. Great for handling a project needing some flexibility with movement. I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Feedback

customer_reviews.title: Great trim router.
customer_reviews.text: I have used the trim router and love it. Its small size is great for using on face frames of cabinets and other tight places. I have not used all the attachments, but I bought the whole kit in case I need them. Love the soft start feature, variable speed, and the spindle lock. Only thing I would change is I would have liked to have a clear base in order to see better the work area.
customer_reviews.author: Ronwasright

customer_reviews.title: tried and true
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because a veteran finish guy had one. I got to use it a couple times and decided I needed one. great one handed operation for smaller bits like roundovers. a 1/8" roundover makes such a big difference, but its just not worth it to get out a full size router for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Won't secure router bit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to do light trim work on wood projects. My first and only attempt as to do a simple 3/16 round over . The bit slowly dropped from the collet. I retightened the bit using as much force as I could safely use. The bit still came out. The depth setting is strange at best but does seem to work once you fiddle with it. I have several Bosch routers that have been excellent, however this is a big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: cielo

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: I always have had good success with Bosch tools. This is a nice kit with everything a person needs for most applications of laminate. I wish there was a depth control for the offset base, but no doubt that would limit how close a cut you can get.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Yarrow

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy depth adjustment mechanism
customer_reviews.text: Nice router, but it's depth adjustment makes a flimsy system. Adjustment usually shifts as soon as the clamp is engaged. To make fine adjustments, you'll want to use the fine adj knob. But in order for that knob to work, you'll have to release the clamp. You are back to square one.
customer_reviews.author: MU

customer_reviews.title: Bosch has lost it.  Will never purchase another product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is terrible! I have had a porter cable laminate router for 10+ years and was great. The motor finally went out on it. This router WILL NOT STAY at the desired depth. It will move! Tightened down the cheap astro screw to make the clamp tighter....NOPE! Still move. Bosch makes shiait products these days!
customer_reviews.author: Shoe

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: Small size means 'forgiving' in the hand. Plenty of power. It's a hardwood routing champ. I keep it chucked with the same bit geometry to save setup time. It's the 3rd palm router I'm using from Bosch for specific bit set-ups. Buy 2 or 3. Great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Sotto voce

customer_reviews.title: Great product, one flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Great little trim router. Very solid and cuts nicely. Only complaint and the reason for 4 stars is the collet is a poor design. I broke it the first day I was using it when I got in a hurry messing around with a piece of wood. Was just practicing some free hand grooves on a piece of pine and the bit got in a small bind. Collet busted and I just thought it was my lack of skill. After researching it a bit, I discovered this is a common flaw and replacements are sold in 2 packs. So, go ahead an order the Colt. Nice product, but order a package of back up collets to have on hand!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, as it can be slowed for plastic so's ...
customer_reviews.text: A high quality tool. I'm using it for engraving in a milling machine. Perfect, as it can be slowed for plastic so's not to melt it. Highly recommended for this use and appears to be a fine router, too. Bob B Fallbrook CA
customer_reviews.author: TheAeroSmith

customer_reviews.title: I love using this router
customer_reviews.text: I love using this router. It is the first trim router I've owned, and it has completely changed the way I work and plan projects. With a larger router I always avoided handheld work because it felt clumsy. This router is easily maneuvered one-handed, and the variable speed allows me to slow down the rpm to make it a much quieter tool. The single-wrench and shaft-locking button makes it easier to change bits, and is a wonderful improvement over two-wrench collets. The included edge guide is very crude, but work well enough when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: Very nice router. This is my second one. One of them is used just on construction grade lumber and the second is used on finer wood in my woodworking shop. Highly recommends.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Beware: Router base slips while in use
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this for a while and it worked fine. Then in the middle of rounding the sides of a finger pull hole it slipped downward and ruined the project. Tried tightening the nut that holds the clamp but still it slips. I think it’s a design flaw. Now l’m Leary of the router. Suggest you beware.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Sauer

customer_reviews.title: Good case
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and weight of this router. It has decent HP for what it is. I got it for rounding over narrow boards. I like the soft start. The rpm dial is not something I've done a lot of fiddling with. It seems nice if I knew how use it properly.
customer_reviews.author: Pat G

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to use at work and mounted it on a table. The ease of use is amazing, and make wood work much more manageable. Due to how easy it is to use, i ended up taking a few side projects on my own just so i can use this. It can also take some serious daily abuse, so be sure this will last.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Guevara

customer_reviews.title: Small routers
customer_reviews.text: I Love Bosch routers, plenty of power, I own the table, the 23, and the 1617. I bought this for Formica jobs. Small enough for repair work. Next time I will record the work. Gets close to corners easily
customer_reviews.author: Sharpeguns

customer_reviews.title: Professional Carpenter
customer_reviews.text: It's a workhorse. Square base is easy to control and adjusting the depth is simple. I use it at work for all my needs. Great for laminate and routing wood. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Charles H

customer_reviews.title: Nice Small Router
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it much yet, but it is the usual good Bosch quality. It does have one major flaw. The base is seldom perpendicular (at right angles) to the chuck. Finewoodworking magazine mentioned that this could be corrected by shimming the sub-base, but I found that the method of tightening the base to the motor does not give a consistant angle for shimming. The router would still be useful for laminate trimming and small edge moulding, but precision rabbetts and dadoes will require checking the perpendicular alignment after each height adjustment. I'm a little disappointed, but will be keeping it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Great Scott

customer_reviews.title: ... particular palm router b/c woodworking magazine rated it as best in class
customer_reviews.text: I bought this particular palm router b/c woodworking magazine rated it as best in class. I use it to make small signs, etc in my garage. get some small 1/16 & 1/8 router bits too.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Kline

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so great. First palm/trim router I've owned. I wish I would've gotten one a long time ago. Fits my needs perfectly. I've used it, so far, for edge work on plinth blocks and hinge mortising.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Good tolerances
customer_reviews.text: Like others say, the bit does come loose, but speed control is nice. For small home projects it works well. I just got done with a small project and it worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: Agustin Mercado

customer_reviews.title: Love the feel
customer_reviews.text: Love the feel, weight and power but am having major problems with the clamping mechanism. Ruined an otherwise very nice cutting board when the clamping system slipped and the bit dove into the wood. If I tighten the small nut on the clamp, them it is difficult to make any adjustment. Anybody else having this problem - finding the right about of tension to keep the clamp working? Also had an extremely difficult time getting a bit to fit into the collet. Thinking about returning this if I can't figure out a fix.
customer_reviews.author: William Schultz

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome little tool!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my husband. We added new laminate to our kitchen counter tops and this router was a life saver! It trimmed the laminate beautifully. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Vicky K

customer_reviews.title: Not so bad though, I'll have a back-up if I can ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't sneeze when you press the quantity button when ordering this tool. I did and ended up with 2! Not so bad though, I'll have a back-up if I can ever wear this 1st one out. This is one tuff little router. It does everything I want it to without slowing down or overheating like another brand I replaced it with. I really like the ease of bit changing and the no-nonsense wrench that comes with the set. If buying this tool, be sure to order the extra base that makes it into a mini router too - very handy.
customer_reviews.author: John R Meister

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying Woodworking
customer_reviews.text: This router tool has improved my versatility when I require it. My woodworking projects are sometimes challenging. This tool adds to my ability to meet them.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa Magana

customer_reviews.title: Quality router for DIY use
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. Paired it with a set of cheap bits from Amazon and have used it on quite a bit of 3/4 plywood with a rollover bit along the edges. No issues. Plenty of power and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Jeff O

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and good router
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup and use, took me just a few min to have ready and starting my project (a work bench with several cutouts). Only negative is the power cord is somewhat hard to fit into the box after usage (even if it has plenty of space). An LED light would also be a "nice to have".
customer_reviews.author: Roger B.

customer_reviews.title: Bosch makes amazing tools
customer_reviews.text: I love my Bosch palm router. I keep it handy in the shop for quick little trim jobs. It’s made by Bosch, so you know it’s quality, and for the price, this is a must-have tool
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Nice router
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed, adjustments were easy once I read the directions. Delivered April, 2019... mine did not come in a plastic storage case, just a cardboard box.
customer_reviews.author: KLM

customer_reviews.title: Nice router, but shaft not perpendicular to base
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice router, but I agree with many who said the base isn't perpendicular to the shaft. I returned it and got another one and it was about the same. I decided to keep it, I shimmed the base .030inches with a couple washers. Works fine now. I made sure it was twisted to the lock position, I adjusted the clamp tight, then looser with no change. By the way, Amazon was great. Exchanged it no problem. Very fast shipment of replacement. Amazon is always my first choice when it comes to ordering something online. Everything is usually fine but on the rare occasion that there is an issue, they have always taken care of me. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive description
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and when I received the package I only received the router and the wrenches, no edge guide, no case, no collets. Amazon sent me a replacement and the replacement packs the same items from my order. The item description is deceptive and inaccurate
customer_reviews.author: Pakorro

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful and effective
customer_reviews.text: I have three "full size" routers but this is the one I will use whenever possible. I feel like I have more control when doing free hand routing and I can see what I'm doing much better. Of course you are limited to using smaller shank bits but that is really not an issue since you would not be using this router when 1/2 inch router bits are called for. It takes a little practice to learn how to set and adjust the cutting depth but thats my problem not the tools.
customer_reviews.author: MROJERRY

customer_reviews.title: Bosch Versatile
customer_reviews.text: A truly laminate trimmer that is actually more versatile. My brother has 2 of these, endorsed my adding one to my shop. Limited to using 1/4 size router bits... I am not sure if I have yet discovered the limit to this router. Love it. Kudo's to Bosch for going lower in HP at a time when you'd think more HP is the norm.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael E. Chaves

customer_reviews.title: Great handheld router!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little router for smaller projects. negatives for me was a small platform, and the different distances from centerline to outside edge of the clear plastic deck.
customer_reviews.author: Baker One

customer_reviews.title: The edge guide is mostly useless, it doesn't hold very strongly and can shift ...
customer_reviews.text: The edge guide is mostly useless, it doesn't hold very strongly and can shift position while in use. I recommend making a jig instead. The router's pretty good otherwise. Don't forget to buy a set of bits.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Kit, however
customer_reviews.text: My particular kit had some small parts missing. I was able to get replacement screws from Bosch Customer Service. It took about 40 minutes on the phone to work out what screws needed to be supplied. Worse, however, is that a plastic cover on the offset base was not fully on the aluminum casting. Tech support suggested a soft blow hammer to seat the plastic. That did not completely work. Bosch says to ship back to seller, and seller does not normally carry this item. This is too much cost and hassle to get a new tool working.
customer_reviews.author: Rollin

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I love this router! It has the power to do the work you typically will do with a router held in your hands, rather than in a table. It is light, solid and easily maneuverable. I expected this router to be the lightweight in my collection, suitable only for really small jobs, but am now pleasantly surprised to see it can do so much more. It's big brothers have their place, but that is most likely fixed to the router table. For darn near everything else this is my clear favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bill

customer_reviews.title: A Complete Package
customer_reviews.text: There are times when a Trim Router can be used for something other than flush trimming. This is where the Edge Guide comes into play. I looked at the Porter "Cable trim router but it didn't include an Edge Guide and the local supplier didn't have one in stock and wasn't enthusiastic about ordering one. Thank you but I will continue to shop for what I want. How often will I use the edge guide? Probably not too often but it was essential for the project I was currently working on.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence F. Grundy

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: The smaller sized router works great! My regular one is just too big for my hands (a woman with smaller hands) - I always have to let go of one of the handles to reach the cutoff switch. This new one is light and easy to use. It came with 2 wrenches - one for the collet and one to use to tighten the clamp that holds the unit. I didn't have any problems changing bits. It would be nice if it had a clear base. Otherwise, I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Router is great as for weekend worrier. Minus one star for case. Seems case is for bigger set and realy difficult to place router or bits set into.
customer_reviews.author: DrCat

customer_reviews.title: LOVE This Router!
customer_reviews.text: The Colt is just what I need for my home shop. I just wish it would fit into a router table, it would save a lot of time and effort.
customer_reviews.author: CW Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight fits like a glove in the hand have all the control unlike a big router this is a big at heart router with some gitup
customer_reviews.author: ronald kiser

customer_reviews.title: Awesome - 1st Router
customer_reviews.text: With a great apprehension of having no experience of usage, however, with good price from Amazon, I finally decided to buy my 1st router. I didn't realize the bits don't come with router which are pricey at big box stores. I found 15 piece Router Bit Set, 1/4" Shank from Amazon which was 1/3 of price at HD and Lowes. It arrived on time in a wooden box and perfect timing for accesorrizing my new shed. Router is powerful, easy to use, and it is just perfect tool for me to do any home improvement project that requires it. This is a great buy and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: AveretJoe

customer_reviews.title: I needed a small router to get into a tight ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small router to get into a tight spot. This worked well for that project and I anticipate that it will be a regular go to router for lighter jobs. Please read the instructions on how to lock the depth. I didn't and found the depth drifting. User error.
customer_reviews.author: She

customer_reviews.title: Durable with quality functionality
customer_reviews.text: One of the most durable well designed and engineered routers capable of achieving quality functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick T.

customer_reviews.title: A great small router
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have, the first I sold it to a friend, I have been working trimming with bigger 1618EVS from Bosch but I think Colt is better suited, and it is, I really enjoy working with Bosch's routers and Colt has it's own merits, enough power, easy to work with a really nice power tool, best in it's class maybe. I find no sinlge issue I do not like of it. I would obviously recommend this product for any DIY'er, semi pro or professional.
customer_reviews.author: E. G. Cruz

customer_reviews.title: I really like to micro adjust on the base
customer_reviews.text: I really like to micro adjust on the base, and the simple edge guild that comes with it works well too. This little beauty is really handy for smaller spaces where my larger Bosch router won't fit.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great value and ease of operation.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to mortise several doors. Had never used router previously and this one worked flawlessly. Great tool for the $$. Less expensive on Amazon that local big box store. Looking at purchasing other bits for other uses now that doors have been finished.
customer_reviews.author: Freemanw

customer_reviews.title: Top quality router
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router. Lightweight and easily adjustable. I use it mainly for handle held routing on construction sites - finishing edges on porch rails, mortising door hinges and plates, recessing drawer and door handles. Does it all with ease. Case has enough room inside to keep your bits together as well.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Gee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Great little router. I bought this because I needed it for one project, but I knew I would reach for it time and again, and I do. Extremely well engineered, and comes in a quality tool case, and has an extra-long cord. This is a highly rated little router, and with good reason.
customer_reviews.author: Double Dee

customer_reviews.title: Very nice compact router
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice compact router which I have so far used a couple times and my initial thoughts are that it will serve many of my handheld router applications for years to come. It has sufficient power and speed for all applications which I would expect to be using it for. I only gave it 4 stars because with a router this new and for this amount of money, it should have built in LEDs to illuminate your work. It does not resulting in a degree of difficulty in tracking exactly where the router bit actually is.
customer_reviews.author: pgould66

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool
customer_reviews.text: I have two full size routers that I just begun to use. I became interested in a trim router while working with my neighbor who has a older Rockwell trim router. Knowing that Bosch has a good name for tools and after reading some reviews, I purchased this item on Amazon. The price was over $30.00 cheaper than Home Depot or Lowe's. I have used this item three times and am very satisfied. Being a once in a while wood worker, this tool will be more than satisfactory for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Poppa of 4

customer_reviews.title: The Price is Right
customer_reviews.text: This is the right tool for the job. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Baller

customer_reviews.title: Bosch excellence.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say that hasn't already been said? Excellent Bosch product. Well made and easy to use. Amazon had the best price I could find. Case has slots for plunger and other accesories.
customer_reviews.author: AlanG

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty cool. Easy to use and is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Z

customer_reviews.title: Picture in display is not in order
customer_reviews.text: Tried four or five time to get the Colt with the carrying case and the guide. Each time all they would send me was the Colt by itself. Go figure
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Urban

customer_reviews.title: Awesome small router
customer_reviews.text: Best little router out there! Eady to handle and control!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Piece of Equipment
customer_reviews.text: Very nice router. Compact, powerful, variable speed with soft start, multiple bases (including plunge base) available. I have several Bosch tools, both corded and battery-powered, and I love them all.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but depth adjustment too weak
customer_reviews.text: When pressure is put against the unit it slips and will not maintain set depth. Fine for light trim work but looks and specs better than it is. Porter Cable is much more secure. I am not sure why they bother with variable speed if the depth slips with any sort of pressure. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Brown

customer_reviews.title: easy to read depth increments
customer_reviews.text: Cant beat a Bosch. Strong variable speed motor, easy to read depth increments, easy to adjust, comfortable in hand. Run it all day every day, purrs right along.
customer_reviews.author: uɐʎɹ

customer_reviews.title: I have two of these, one used on my ...
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these, one used on my CNC. It runs hours at a time. The second one is there as a backup in case i burn the first one up. After 5 months, the CNC router is still going strong. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Laser Man

customer_reviews.title: Accessory problem
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a very good router. It has done what I wanted it to do without any problems. The issue I have is that the 17mm wrench used to tighten the bit is maybe 16mm or possibly 15mm. In other words, it just does not fit. A 17mm Craftsman wrench from my tool box fit nicely. Bottom line, good router with a accessory problem.
customer_reviews.author: m a pineault

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Great hand router but hard to set accurate when changing bits for me it seemed I had to adjust a few times to get right cut. But it could be just me because I've only used plunge routers.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Carter

customer_reviews.title: Small yet powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it a couple of times so far but very pleased with its performance. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: grant johnston

customer_reviews.title: Great router!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first palm router, I like it a lot! Bought it to mill aluminum with and it's working great. I've always had big Sears router for woodworking but this Bosch is going to get more use on those projects. Easy to handle and control.
customer_reviews.author: kelly nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Router.
customer_reviews.text: Nice router. Been using this to mill some aluminum, not quite what it was designed for but it has really outdone itself. The case that it comes in is huge. Which is good if you buy the accessories to go with it, but it is a little bit of a space waster.
customer_reviews.author: Justin D

customer_reviews.title: Good router but accessories are a but lacking.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good tool but the regular base will not accept a standard router busing. For that you have to order the PR010 Round Subbase. In a kit with several different bases you'd think it would be included. The worst part is that once you attach the PR010 base the tool will not fit in the case!. This is frustrating; I don't want to take out 4 screws to put the router away, then reassemble and center the base when I want to use it again. So a good router with a poorly designed case and accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Aiken

customer_reviews.title: Since buying this router, my Bosch 1617EV has stayed ...
customer_reviews.text: Since buying this router, my Bosch 1617EV has stayed in the case. This router seems to fill the gap between a big table mounted router and a small trim router. Very versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Adam A.

customer_reviews.title: Thanks stew Mac.
customer_reviews.text: Took the plunge and ordered since it’s what stew Mac said I should get. I love it. Great for pickup routing (my reason for buying it) Way easier and faster than my router.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: It's a Bosch! Of course its a great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, works like a charm. Used it quite a lot but be aware that you limit yourself to 1/4" tools. If that's what you need then get it you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gunnie

product_meta.title: Bosch Router Tool, Colt 1-Horsepower 5.6 Amp Electronic Variable-Speed Palm Router PR20EVS
product_meta.description: Style:1.0 HP Variable Speed RouterThe Bosch PR20EVS Colt electronic variable Speed palm router combines power, precision and versatility in a small sized tool. It has a 1.0 horsepower, 5.6 amp motor that spins at a variable Speed of 16,000 to 35,000 rpm. The variable Speed dial is conveniently mounted on top of the tool body. The router features constant response circuitry, which maintains a consistent Speed by detecting heavy loads and increasing power to maintain the selected rpm. It features soft start circuitry, which reduces startup torque. Additionally, the depth can be adjusted by simply aligning and lowering the motor and then locking the router in position with the clamping level. Micro fine adjustments are equally effortless, thanks to the wheel on the back of the router's base. It accepts standard 1/4 Inch bits for flexibility, with an impressive max cutter diameter of 1 5/16 Inch. The motor housing has a palm shaped, rubber over molded grip that allows for comfortable operation. The included rugged aluminum fixed base is durable, solid and precise. Includes: (1) PR20EVS Palm Router, (1) PR001 Fixed Base, (1) 1/4 Inch Self Releasing Collet Chuck, (1) Shaft Wrench, (1) Collet Wrench.
feature_bullets: PR20EVS Colt Palm Router features a 1.0 HorsePower 5.6 amp variable speed motor with speeds from 16,000 to 35,000 rpm

Convenient: Provides a straight edge guide to lead router along edges of work piece or up to 3-5/8 inch from edge; The wood router also features an angled cord exit to keep the cord out of the way when working
Durable: The rugged aluminum fixed base of the wood router is durable, solid and precise; The PR20EVS features unique finger support pockets for additional stability, especially when trimming edges
Precision: The fast and precise depth adjustment system allows both macro and micro adjustment while the quick clamp system allows motor to be easily adjusted or moved from base to base

Versatile: The PR20EVS provides enhanced bit capacity with a fixed base that accepts bits up to 1 5/16 inch in diameter; Versatile bit changing system allows for fast, easy bit changes using two wrenches or spindle lock and one wrench

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,223 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
